element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm generates two new layers (raster and vector) with a channel network extracted from a DEM and a layer with addittional information. This second layer should contain a variable that can be used to delineate the channel network. FLow accumulation is the most common used one.

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: * D. P. Tarboton, D.G.; Ames. Advances in the mapping of flow networks from digital elevation data. In World Water and Environmental Resources Congress,2001. * D. Mark. Automated detection of drainage networks from digital elevation models. Cartographica, 21:168-178, 1984.

element.name: THRESHOLDLAYER
element.text: A layer to locate stream headers. Flow accumulation is usually used as the threshold layer.

element.name: METHOD
element.text: a condition that the cells of the threshold layer should meet to be part of a stream * Greater than * Lower than

element.name: THRESHOLD
element.text: A threshold value to apply the above mentioned condition. It must be in the same units as the threshold layer. The algorithm look for cells that meet the threshold criteria but their upslope cell does not meet it. These are used as starting cells, and channels are delineated from those cells downhill.

element.name: NETWORK
element.text: the values of the cells indicate the hierarchical order (Strahler) of the streams that flow through each one of them. In those cells where no stream is defined, no data values will appear.

element.name: NETWORKVECT
element.text: The channel network in vector format
